attributes.action: Recommend Eric Clapton for a knighthood
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With a 1994 OBE and 2004 CBE for services to music, it's Clapton's time for Knighthood. 

He meets the stated criteria of significant contribution in his field of activity, through sustained commitment which enhances the reputation (and finances) of Britain.

For most of his life he's led a fairly exemplary life, avoiding many of the usual controversies of iconic rock stars.

He's dealt with with drug and alcohol problems, and through his experiences as an addict established a rehab unit which he's supported with a lot of his own money, including millions of pounds raised from auctioning his guitar collection.

He's created entertaining music for more than forty years, been a positive influence on youngsters, and is the only person to be inducted three times into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

As deserving as Jagger, McCartney, Elton John, and Cliff Richard, 'Ladies and gentlemen... Sir Eric Clapton.' it even sounds good.

Eric, thanks. You've made a lot of people happy. Rock on.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.direct.gov.uk/honours
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
